title: How can we spend our life without electrical gadgets? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi, Life is much more than Electrical gadgets. You need them, just fulfill your need and keep them with yourself. You need to control yourself otherwise these things will control your mind. Let's take the example of the cell phone device, that meant for communication, but people are playing with our mind, likes dislikes, Marketing strategies on the bases of the data is a big game. In the terms of social need the strong urge to post your photos, you feel like to stay connected in the virtual world. life seems tough without electrical devices, but at the same time, you need to figure out what actually matters in life, the real purpose of being here…the task you want to finish before you die…its just a virtual world, life is more than that.

Quite easily. It’s all just what you’re used to. Humans adapt. It’s what we do best. We’re tool users with opposable thumbs and big brains. We have been devising gadgets for as long as there have been humans and we’ve been on this Earth a very long time. The gadgets we use daily today are a VERY recent thing. And if by “gadgets” you mean smart phones, they’ve only been around in common use for about ten years or so. For the majority of my life I did just fine without the silly black rectangle in my pocket. Unsure if you intended that question to be rhetorical, but there ya go. :)

What an adventurous idea. I think it would be just wonderful. Like stealing out pages from the old ‘time machine’. I would love to live like that for just the heck of it (at least for some days). Getting up with the birds chirping and going to bed by dusk. No TV, no mobile, no radio, no phone calls … how relaxing. Experience the shiver of having a cold bath, eating fresh veggies cooked on fire. Being undisturbed with your loved ones. Ooooh ! Irresistible.

Thanks for a2a. There was no electronic engineer in olden times but people lived. It is only a recent phenomenon. STYLE OF LIVING HAS CHANGED. Our way of living changes as new gadgets appear impacting our daily lives. Some times the change is unnoticeable. Look at the shepherd; he was seen holding and playing lute but today they have mobile phone in their hands, listening while the herd around observes!
